duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure sustainable operations and growth of the organization through accounting, reporting, strategic planning, budgeting, and monitoring.
Business partner to the Strategic Planning Committee, responsible for designing the annual strategic planning calendar.
Responsible for final financial reporting under both US GAAP and IFRS, and coordination with external auditors.
Build on the organization’s strong legacy while advancing priority objectives for continued growth.
Conduct complex analysis of financial data, forecast and assess financial impact of proposed plans and projects.
Lead business transformation, digital transformation, and process engineering.
Lead, develop, and retain a strong, diverse, professional team.
Outstanding verbal and written communication and presentation skills, including interacting with a Board of Directors and other external stakeholders.

education_certification.credential: Business degree, preferably accounting major, or a significant concentration in accounting/finance. Master’s degree in finance or accounting preferred. Active accounting credential, licensure, or designation required; CMA preferred, CPA or CA will be considered.
